articles.description: Today, the US House of Representatives voted to renew the law that allows the National Security Agency to surveil communications between American companies and foreigners located outside of the country without a warrant. It's Section 702 of the FISA Amendment…

articles.description: Many of tech’s most prominent executives have joined more than 100 American business leaders in signing an open letter asking Congress to take action on the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program before it expires on March 5. Read More

articles.description: The government of the U.K. has denied a motion to grant Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, who has been holed up in the Ecuadorian embassy in London since 2012 over fears he could be extradited, diplomatic protections. Read more...

articles.description: At their peak, earmarks still represented only a sliver of the annual federal budget, but they were banned with a bipartisan bill in 2011. President Trump and members of Congress are now discussing bringing them back.
